page.title: 17Bragenham.
page.content: Towards the three locks lies the hamlet called{Bragenham}where there is a cottage called Ludly cottage. A man who lives there called Mr David Scott. He seemed to know quite a lot of local history. He told us the cottage was once called Bragenham Farm for the reason that it was in Bragenham on Bragenham lane. Ludly means Low pastures. Why they called the cottage Low pastures we do not know. By the sign post is a Victorian post box. This was usually only used by two houses- Ludly cottage and another house further up the track. Half way down the track is a footpath. This footpath leads to a farm called Bragenham farm. In the farm live Mr and Mrs Gotzhein. Half way down the footpath is a deep quarry. We're not sure whether this was to do with the brick works.
